entry.title: Week 27, 2025: Test compatibility issue reported for new OCaml version affecting multiple architectures
entry.content:
Summary

Single test failure issue opened concerning dscheck_htbl test compatibility with new OCaml version

Activity

  • Test compatibility issue reported by Gianfranco Costamagna affecting dscheck_htbl test execution across multiple architectures including amd64, arm64, ppc64el, and s390x (#187)
entry.summary: Test compatibility issue reported for new OCaml version affecting multiple architectures

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: Benchmark improvements with heap-allocated blocks and CI workflow updates for Windows testing
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged focusing on benchmark realism and CI infrastructure improvements

Activity

  • Benchmark enhancement by Vesa Karvonen merged comprehensive changes to make queue and stack benchmarks more realistic by using heap-allocated blocks instead of immediate values, affecting all benchmark files (#185)
  • CI infrastructure update by Carine Morel merged fix for Windows CI workflow, updating OCaml version to 5.3.0 and setup-ocaml action to v3.3.2 (#186)
entry.summary: Benchmark improvements with heap-allocated blocks and CI workflow updates for Windows testing

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Discussion on work-stealing deque synchronization issues with potential atomic field solution
entry.summary: Discussion on work-stealing deque synchronization issues with potential atomic field solution

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Benchmarking methodology improvements and CI upgrades with realistic heap-allocated data
entry.content:
Summary

Newly opened PR for realistic benchmarking methodology improvements

Activity

  • New PR opened by Vesa Karvonen proposing to benchmark queues and stacks with heap-allocated blocks rather than immediate values to avoid misleading performance results that hide write barrier costs (#185)
entry.summary: Benchmarking methodology improvements and CI upgrades with realistic heap-allocated data

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: Build dependency issue identified and ongoing work-stealing deque synchronization discussion
entry.content:
Summary

One new issue opened regarding build dependencies with ongoing technical discussion

Activity

  • Build dependency issue opened by Simon Krajewski highlighting that lockfree alcotest dependency is not marked as with-test, causing unnecessary test dependencies during installation (#184)
  • Ongoing synchronization discussion in work-stealing deque implementation with Vesa Karvonen providing technical analysis of memory model considerations and suggesting atomic write fence alternatives (#183)
entry.summary: Build dependency issue identified and ongoing work-stealing deque synchronization discussion

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Discussion continued on work-stealing deque synchronization issue affecting memory safety
entry.summary: Discussion continued on work-stealing deque synchronization issue affecting memory safety

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: Code formatting update and new lockfree priority queue development with synchronization question raised
entry.content:
Summary

New lockfree priority queue PR opened and synchronization concerns raised about work-stealing deque

Activity

  • Lockfree priority queue implementation opened by Carine Morel based on Saturn.Skiplist with dscheck and stm tests, pending benchmarks and linearizable length consideration (#182)
  • Code formatting standardization completed by Carine Morel updating OCamlformat version across the entire codebase (#181)
entry.summary: Code formatting update and new lockfree priority queue development with synchronization question raised

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Documentation improvements with automated GitHub Pages deployment and fixed documentation links.
entry.content:
Summary

Two documentation-focused PRs merged improving project maintenance and developer experience.

Activity

  • Documentation infrastructure improved with @art-w implementing automated odoc deployment workflow (#179) and Carine Morel fixing broken API documentation links (#180)
  • Repository settings updated by maintainers to enable GitHub Actions for Pages deployment, ensuring future documentation updates are automatically published
entry.summary: Documentation improvements with automated GitHub Pages deployment and fixed documentation links.

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Saturn 1.0 release week with new lockfree bag data structure, skiplist API extensions, and comprehensive documentation improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major 1.0 release preparation with extensive documentation improvements, API standardization, and new data structure addition

Activity

  • New issue opened by Carine Morel for extending skiplist API with additional functions matching hash table operations (#178)
  • Saturn 1.0 release completed with Carine Morel merging comprehensive preparation work including lockfree bag implementation, skiplist improvements, and documentation standardization (#176, #175, #173, #172)
  • Documentation enhancement effort delivered through multiple PRs including comprehensive API documentation updates, usage examples, and standardized formatting across all data structures (#177, #174)
  • Project maintenance activities including dependency updates for compatibility, minor documentation fixes, and 1.0 release tracking issue closure (#123)
entry.summary: Saturn 1.0 release week with new lockfree bag data structure, skiplist API extensions, and comprehensive documentation improvements

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Week focused on Saturn 1.0 release preparation with documentation improvements and new data structures
entry.content:
Summary

Five new PRs opened for Saturn 1.0 release preparation including documentation updates and new features

Activity

  • Five new PRs opened this week including lockfree bag implementation by Carine Morel (#173), skiplist documentation improvements (#172), README file updates (#169), useful warnings additions (#170), and work stealing deque updates (#168)
  • Saturn 1.0 release preparation reached completion with Carine Morel closing the progress tracking issue (#123) and announcing release for beginning of next week
  • Documentation improvements delivered across multiple data structures including Michael Scott queue uniformization (#167) and SPSC queue standardization (#165)
  • Issue closure activity with multiple historical issues resolved including examples addition (#57), bounded data structures request (#52), OCaml version recommendation update (#95), skiplist implementation rejection (#87), kcas_data import cancellation (#93), and linearizability documentation issue (#132)
entry.summary: Week focused on Saturn 1.0 release preparation with documentation improvements and new data structures

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: Major release preparation with new bounded data structures and comprehensive API uniformization
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened this week alongside eight comprehensive merges completing API uniformization

Activity

  • Three new PRs opened this week including MPSC queue updates by Carine Morel (#162), Michael-Scott queue uniformization (#167), and work-stealing deque improvements (#168)
  • Bounded data structures milestone reached with Carine Morel merging bounded stack implementation (#156) and bounded queue implementation (#160), addressing over a year of development from original prototype by Vesa Karvonen (#83)
  • Performance optimization delivery with Vesa Karvonen completing work-stealing deque optimizations (#124) showing 2-3x throughput improvements through false sharing elimination and contention reduction
  • API consistency improvements through multiple uniformization efforts including enhanced Treiber stack functions (#158), function renaming for consistency (#164), and benchmark infrastructure updates (#161)
  • Testing and documentation enhancements with comprehensive test additions for bounded queue functionality (#166) and minor fixes to Treiber stack implementation (#163)
entry.summary: Major release preparation with new bounded data structures and comprehensive API uniformization

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Bounded queue implementation opened in new PR with benchmark improvements for data structure performance
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened focused on bounded queue implementation and benchmark improvements

Activity

  • Carine Morel opened comprehensive bounded queue implementation (#160) featuring non-blocking operations to avoid Picos dependency, with extensive additions including documentation examples, tests, and API functions like is_full
  • Carine Morel opened benchmark improvements (#161) enhancing readability of benchmarks for safe and unsafe versions of hash table and adding benchmarks for unsafe Michael-Scott queue
  • Ongoing Treiber stack enhancements (#158) with new functions for list operations, sequence operations, and consumer functions to match bounded stack API
  • Long-running lock-free bounded queue development (#83) by Vesa Karvonen received technical discussion about value handling in parallel pop operations
entry.summary: Bounded queue implementation opened in new PR with benchmark improvements for data structure performance

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Library restructuring by removing Saturn_lockfree package and consolidating all functionality into single Saturn package
entry.content:
Summary

Major package restructuring work completed with extensive testing and benchmark updates

Activity

  • Package restructuring completed by Carine Morel removing Saturn_lockfree package and consolidating all functionality into main Saturn package (#159)
  • Codebase migration with 76 files changed involving movement of all source files from src_lockfree/ to src/ directory and updating import statements throughout benchmark and test files (#159)
  • Build configuration updates including modification of dune-project, opam files, and test configurations to reflect new unified package structure (#159)
  • Code review provided by Sudha Parimala with approval and discussion about future plans for blocking data structures (#159)
entry.summary: Library restructuring by removing Saturn_lockfree package and consolidating all functionality into single Saturn package

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: Major codebase restructuring with new hash table implementation and removal of deprecated components
entry.content:
Summary

Two major PRs merged focusing on Saturn 1.0 preparation with deprecated component removal

Activity

  • Repository cleanup for Saturn 1.0 release preparation with Carine Morel removing the Relaxed_queue module (outperformed by Michael-Scott queue) and the nested M module in Ws_deque to simplify the API (#157)
  • Hash table integration from Picos library by Carine Morel adding comprehensive lock-free hash table functionality with both safe and unsafe implementations, including extensive testing infrastructure (#154)
  • Multiple PR closures as part of Saturn 1.0 roadmap decisions: @art-w agreed to close rendezvous implementation (#68) noting integration into DLA and Picos, Carine Morel closed bounded queue (#78) and lazy skiplist (#90) PRs due to performance and architecture decisions
  • Bounded stack development with Carine Morel opening (#156) based on previous blocking implementation (#155) to avoid Picos dependency
  • API enhancement work with Carine Morel opening PR to add functions to Treiber stack matching bounded stack capabilities (#158)
entry.summary: Major codebase restructuring with new hash table implementation and removal of deprecated components

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Five long-standing PRs were closed without merging, including experimental queue implementations and blocking stack features
entry.content:
Summary

Repository maintenance focused on closing five unmerged experimental PRs spanning various queue and stack implementations

Activity

  • Repository cleanup involved closing five experimental PRs without merging: blocking bounded stack by Carine Morel (#155), MPMC 2-stack queue by Vesa Karvonen (#112), lazy queue implementation (#145), experimental Once and Chainable abstractions (#110), and kcas_data import by Sudha Parimala (#96)
  • Final discussions on blocking bounded stack implementation included Vesa Karvonen providing extensive technical feedback on memory usage, trigger signaling order, and fairness considerations before closure (#155)
  • Legacy PR closure included Ambre Austen Suhamy closing their 2022 CTrie implementation PR as stale (#49)
entry.summary: Five long-standing PRs were closed without merging, including experimental queue implementations and blocking stack features
